text: Yusuke Kizu (born 2 December 1995) is a Japanese rugby union player who generally plays as a prop represents Japan internationally and plays for Toyota Verblitz in the Japanese Top League. He was included in the Japanese squad for the 2019 Rugby World Cup which was held in Japan for the first time and for the first time in Asia. == Career == He made his club debut for Toyota Verblitz in 2018. Yusuke made his international debut for Japan against Fiji on 27 July 2019 at the 2019 World Rugby Pacific Nations Cup round match where Japan defeated Fiji 34-21 and later Japan went onto win the tournament for the third time. == References == Category:Japanese rugby union players Category:Living people Category:1995 births Category:Sportspeople from Ōita Prefecture Category:Rugby union props Category:Toyota Verblitz players Category:Japan international rugby union players
title: Yusuke Kizu
